Acute adrenal insufficiency is ''a vital pathology, an extreme emergency''.

Treatment is started as soon as the diagnosis is suspected, even without diagnostic certainty. Hormone levels (cortisol, ACTH) can be measured at a later stage if they are not taken just before emergency treatment. They should not delay treatment.

question.question: What is the appropriate action when acute adrenal insufficiency is suspected?
question.option_a: Wait for definitive diagnostic test results before starting treatment
question.option_b: Measure hormone levels immediately and delay treatment until results are available
question.option_c: Start treatment as soon as the diagnosis is suspected, even without diagnostic certainty
question.option_d: Administer a placebo to see if symptoms improve before starting hormone treatment
